node.title: American journalist jailed for 11 years in Myanmar
node.alt: A bearded man stands on the street in a suit in a black and white photo
node.description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentences US journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years in jail, as he still faces severalÂ more serious charges including terrorism.
node.content:
["A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentenced detained US journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years in prison after finding him guilty on several charges including incitement for allegedly spreading false or inflammatory information.", "Fenster, 37, managing editor of online magazine Frontier Myanmar, was arrested while trying to leave the country in May and has since been held in Yangon's notorious Insein prison.", "He was also found guilty of contacting illegal organisations and violating visa regulations, his lawyer Than Zaw Aung said.", "Fenster still faces two additional charges in a different court for allegedly violating the counterterrorism law and a statute covering treason and sedition.", "These more serious charges, announced this week, are each punishable by a maximum of 20 years in prison.", "", "
Foreign Correspondent looks at what's happening in Myanmar.(Matt Davis)
", "\"There is absolutely no basis to convict Danny of these charges,\" said Thomas Kean, Frontier Myanmar's editor-in-chief.", "\"Everyone at Frontier is disappointed and frustrated at this decision. We just want to see Danny released as soon as possible so he can go home to his family.\"", "Fenster is the only foreign journalist to be convicted of a serious crime since the army seized power in February, ousting the elected government of Aung San Suu Kyi.", "The US government has been pushing for his release.", "In remarks prior to his sentencing, which was not publicly announced, the US\u00a0State Department said: \"The profoundly unjust nature of Danny's\u00a0detention is plain for all the world to see.\"", "", "
Fenster faces terrorism charges.(AP)
", "\"The regime should take the prudent step of releasing him now,\" it said.", "Myanmar has been in chaos since February's military coup.", "The military-installed government has cracked down hard on press freedom, shutting virtually all critical outlets and arresting about 100 journalists, roughly 30 of whom remain in jail.", "Some of the closed outlets have continued operating without a license, publishing online as their staff members dodge arrest.", "The army takeover was met by widespread peaceful protests that were put down with lethal force.", "The Assistance Association for Political Prisoners has detailed the deaths of more than 1,200 civilians, in addition to about 10,000 arrests.", "Armed resistance has since spread, and UN experts and others observers fear the incipient insurgency can slide into civil war.", "AP/Reuters"]
